alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Hall; Kearney (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Adams, northeastern Kearney, eastern Buffalo and southwestern Hall Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ravenna to 7 miles north of Gibbon to 8 miles northwest of Heartwell. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Gibbon around 1120 PM CDT. Shelton around 1130 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wood River and Kenesaw. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 275 and 299. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
